intro: Paris lihengiana, commonly known as the Liheng's Paris, is a rare and endangered species native to China. It is a member of the Melanthiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as mountain forests. Its tuberous roots are of particular interest in botanical studies due to their unique structure and potential medicinal properties. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this rare species from habitat loss and over-collection.
